intro: Pedicularis dulongensis, commonly known as the Dulong's lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred structure that aids in pollination by insects. Pedicularis dulongensis is notable for its specialized adaptations to its harsh, mountainous habitat.
